title: Using PxWebApi v1 with PxWebApiData
text: vignette describes functionality R package PxWebApiData related PxWebApi v1. content vignette written PxWebApi v2 introduced. PxWebApi v2 functionality, see Using PxWebApi v2 PxWebApiData. introduction R package PxWebApiData (PxWebApi v1) given . Six calls main function, ApiData, demonstrated. First, two calls reading data sets shown. third call captures meta data. However, practise, one may look meta data first. three examples background given. Note: Earlier versions vignette demonstrated ‚Äúreadymade datasets GetApiData‚Äù. Statistics Norway remove readymade API 2025, examples now replaced. new PxWebApi 2 now primary API Statistics Norway.

what: Specification by variable indices and variable id‚Äôs
title: Using PxWebApi v1 with PxWebApiData
text: dataset three variables, Region, ContentsCode Tid. variables can used input parameters. two parameters specified variable id‚Äôs one parameter specified indices. Negative values used specify reversed indices. Thus, obtain two first two last years data. list two data frames returned; label version id version. return single dataset labels use function ApiData1. function Apidata2 returns id‚Äôs. return dataset labels id‚Äôs one dataframe use ApiData12.
code: ApiData("https://data.ssb.no/api/v0/en/table/04861",         Region = c("1103", "0301"), ContentsCode = "Bosatte", Tid = c(1, 2, -2, -1)) $`04861: Area and population of urban settlements, by region, contents and year`          region            contents year  value 1 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2000 504348 2 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2002 508134 3 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2024 714630 4 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2025 720631 5     Stavanger Number of residents 2000 106804 6     Stavanger Number of residents 2002 108271 7     Stavanger Number of residents 2024 142897 8     Stavanger Number of residents 2025 143972  $dataset   Region ContentsCode  Tid  value 1   0301      Bosatte 2000 504348 2   0301      Bosatte 2002 508134 3   0301      Bosatte 2024 714630 4   0301      Bosatte 2025 720631 5   1103      Bosatte 2000 106804 6   1103      Bosatte 2002 108271 7   1103      Bosatte 2024 142897 8   1103      Bosatte 2025 143972 ApiData12("https://data.ssb.no/api/v0/en/table/04861",         Region = c("1103", "0301"), ContentsCode = "Bosatte", Tid = c(1, 2, -2, -1)) Warning converted to message: cannot open URL 'https://data.ssb.no/api/v0/en/table/04861': HTTP status was '429 Unknown Error' No internet connection or resource not available: Error in open.connection(con, "rb") :    cannot open the connection to 'https://data.ssb.no/api/v0/en/table/04861' NULL

title: Using PxWebApi v1 with PxWebApiData
text: PxWebApi offers two filters groupings, agg: vs:. can see filters code ‚ÄúAPI Query table‚Äù made table PxWeb. agg: used readymade aggregation groupings. example shows use aggregation age groups aggregated timeseries new Norwegian municipality structure 2020. Also note url /en replaced /. returns labels Norwegian instead English. two limitations PxWebApi using filters. name filter id‚Äôs shown metadata, code ‚ÄúAPI Query table‚Äù. filters agg: vs: can take single elements input. Filter "":"*" eg. TRUE, work agg: vs:. filter vs:, specify grouping value sets, part value pool. possible give single elements input, easier query value pool. means vs: redundant. example Region value pool Fylker (counties) value set. vs:Fylker redundant, return :

title: Using PxWebApi v1 with PxWebApiData
text: text section written new functionality described Using PxWebApi v2 PxWebApiData. legacy function GetApiData() therefore used . However, examples can now run exactly way using get_api_data() instead. Statistics Norway announced PxWebApi 2 now primary API Statbank Norway‚Äôs 7500 public tables. API supports GET queries defined entirely URL. Version 1 PxWebApi continue exist parallel period time, supports POST queries. limited API ‚Äúreadymade datasets‚Äù removed 2025, since PxWebApi 2 offers GET queries. GetApiData function can used URLs PxWebApi 2 similar way previously used ‚Äúreadymade datasets‚Äù. corresponds using parameter getDataByGET = TRUE ApiData function. Corresponding wrapper functions GetApiData1, GetApiData2 GetApiData12 available ApiData1, ApiData2 ApiData12.
code: # Example dataset url1 <- "https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/05810/data?lang=en" x <- GetApiData(url1) Not available - 429 x[[1]]    # Label version of the dataset NULL comment(x) Warning in max(nchar(com)): no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf # More specific query with selected dimensions url2 <- paste0(   "https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/03013/data?lang=en",   "&valueCodes[Konsumgrp]=??",   "&valueCodes[ContentsCode]=KpiIndMnd",   "&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)" )  x2 <- GetApiData2(url2) Not available - 429 x2  # id version of the dataset NULL

title: Using PxWebApi v2 with PxWebApiData
text: vignette describes functionality R package PxWebApiData related PxWebApi v2. new functions follow recommended snake_case naming convention. older functionality, see Using PxWebApi v1 PxWebApiData. vignette first describes function get_api_data() retrieving data pre-made URL. Note function limited PxWebApi. end vignette, also shown data Eurostat can retrieved using get_api_data(). main function PxWebApi v2 package can considered api_data(). closely related ApiData() PxWebApi v1. function api_data() retrieves data one step. Internally, functions query_url() get_api_data() called. described later vignette, package also provides dedicated functions retrieving metadata associated PxWebApi v2.

what: get_api_data(): retrieve data from a pre-made URL
title: Using PxWebApi v2 with PxWebApiData
text: data URL already available, data can retrieved using get_api_data(), illustrated example . return single data frame labels , use function get_api_data_1. function get_api_data_2 returns codes . return data frame containing labels codes, use get_api_data_12. output get_api_data() identical output api_data(), shown . shown, functions info() note() can also used display additional information.
code: url <- paste0(   "https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/04861/data?lang=en",   "&valueCodes[Region]=0301,324*",   "&valueCodes[ContentsCode]=???????",   "&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)" )  get_api_data(url) $`04861: Area and population of urban settlements, by region, contents and year`          region            contents year  value 1 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2024 714630 2 Oslo - Oslove Number of residents 2025 720631 3      Eidsvoll Number of residents 2024  23154 4      Eidsvoll Number of residents 2025  23599 5        Hurdal Number of residents 2024   1174 6        Hurdal Number of residents 2025   1217  $dataset   Region ContentsCode  Tid  value 1   0301      Bosatte 2024 714630 2   0301      Bosatte 2025 720631 3   3240      Bosatte 2024  23154 4   3240      Bosatte 2025  23599 5   3242      Bosatte 2024   1174 6   3242      Bosatte 2025   1217

title: Using PxWebApi v2 with PxWebApiData
text: dataset considered three variables: Region, ContentsCode, Tid. variables can used input parameters. variable can specified using codes corresponding coding used PxWebApi URL queries. Codes can specified directly. also possible truncate codes using asterisk (*) mask individual characters using question mark (?). example , seven characters masked. Using top(2) returns first two values start position. list two data frames returned: one labels one codes. return single data frame labels , use function api_data_1. function api_data_2 returns codes . return data frame containing labels codes, use api_data_12. Internally, data URL first constructed data retrieved using function get_api_data(). obtain generated URL, replace api_data() query_url(). URL example already generated using query_url() example .
code: api_data("https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/04861/data?lang=en",           Region = c("0301", "324*"),           ContentsCode = "???????",           Tid = "top(2)") Warning converted to message: cannot open URL 'https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/04861/metadata?lang=en&outputFormat=json-stat2': HTTP status was '429 Unknown Error' No internet connection or resource not available: Error in open.connection(con, "rb") :    cannot open the connection to 'https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/04861/metadata?lang=en&outputFormat=json-stat2' NULL

title: PX-Web Data by API
text: PX-Web data API: R package PxWebApiData supports PxWebApi v1 PxWebApi v2. example code reads data three national statistical institutes: Statistics Norway, Statistics Sweden, Statistics Finland.

title: PX-Web Data by API
text: PxWebApi v1 supported long-established ApiData() interface. üìå Function reference: ApiData() üìå Vignette: Using PxWebApi v1 PxWebApiData

title: PX-Web Data by API
text: PxWebApi v2 supported set new functions. üìå Function references: get_api_data() ‚Äì retrieve data pre-made URL query_url() ‚Äì generate data URL specifications api_data() ‚Äì specify retrieve data one step (closely related ApiData() PxWebApi v1) meta_frames() ‚Äì metadata structured data frames meta_data() ‚Äì metadata downloaded without processing meta_code_list() ‚Äì metadata code lists üìå Vignette: Using PxWebApi v2 PxWebApiData Official version CRAN: https://cran.r-project.org/package=PxWebApiData

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
text: function read PX-Web data R via API. example code reads data three national statistical institutes, Statistics Norway, Statistics Sweden Statistics Finland.

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
code: ApiData(   urlToData,   ...,   getDataByGET = FALSE,   returnMetaData = FALSE,   returnMetaValues = FALSE,   returnMetaFrames = FALSE,   returnApiQuery = FALSE,   defaultJSONquery = c(1, -2, -1),   verbosePrint = FALSE,   use_factors = FALSE,   urlType = "SSB",   apiPackage = "httr",   dataPackage = "rjstat",   returnDataSet = NULL,   makeNAstatus = TRUE,   responseFormat = "json-stat2" )  GetApiData(..., getDataByGET = TRUE)  pxwebData(..., apiPackage = "pxweb", dataPackage = "pxweb")  PxData(..., apiPackage = "pxweb", dataPackage = "rjstat")  ApiData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  ApiData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  ApiData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  GetApiData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  GetApiData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  GetApiData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  pxwebData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  pxwebData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  pxwebData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  PxData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  PxData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  PxData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
text: urlToData url data id SSB data ... specification JSON query variable getDataByGET TRUE, readymade dataset GET returnMetaData TRUE, metadata returned returnMetaValues TRUE, values metadata returned returnMetaFrames TRUE, values valueTexts metadata returned data frames returnApiQuery TRUE, JSON query returned defaultJSONquery specification variables included ... verbosePrint TRUE, printing console use_factors Parameter fromJSONstat defining whether dimension categories factors character objects. urlType Parameter defining url constructed id number. Currently two Statistics Norway possibilities: "SSB" (Norwegian) "SSBen" (English) apiPackage Package used capture json(-stat) data API: "httr" (default) "pxweb" dataPackage Package used transform json(-stat) data data frame: "rjstat" (default) "pxweb" returnDataSet Possible non-NULL values 1, 2 12. single data set returned data frame. 1: first data set 2: second data set 12: data sets combined makeNAstatus TRUE dataPackage "rjstat" missing entries value, function tries add additional variable, named NAstatus, status codes. explanation status codes provided note part comment attribute, .e. get note(). See bottom example. responseFormat Response format used apiPackage dataPackage defaults  ("json-stat" "json-stat2").

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
text: list two data sets (label id)

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
text: variable specified using variable name input parameter. value can specified : TRUE (), FALSE (eliminated), imaginary value (top), variable indices, original variable id's (values) variable labels (valueTexts). Reversed indices can specified negative values. Indices outside range removed. Variables specified set value defaultJSONquery whose default means first two last elements. value can also specified (unnamed) two-element list corresponding two query elements, filter values. addition possible single-element list. filter set ''. See examples. comment attribute elements label, source, updated added output named character vector. available, elements originating tableid, contents, note also included, resulting vector least three elements. Use comment() view selected metadata elements. Alternatively, use info() note() extract specific parts. documentation two functions provides details. Functionality package pxweb can utilized making use parameters apiPackage dataPackage implemented wrappers PxData pxwebData. data sets large ordinary downloads, PxData can solve problem (multiple downloads). using pxwebData, data downloaded px-json format instead json-stat output data frame organized differently (ContentsCode categories separate variables).

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî ApiData
text: See package vignette aggregations using filter agg.

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî api_data
text: function constructs PxWebApi v2 data URL using query_url() retrieves data using get_api_data().

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî api_data
code: api_data(   url_or_tableid,   ...,   url_type = "ssb",   use_index = FALSE,   default_query = c(1, -2, -1),   return_dataset = NULL,   make_na_status = TRUE,   verbose_print = FALSE )  api_data_1(..., return_dataset = 1)  api_data_2(..., return_dataset = 2)  api_data_12(..., return_dataset = 12)

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî api_data
text: url_or_tableid table id, PxWebApi v2 URL data metadata, metadata returned meta_data() meta_frames(). ... Specification query variable. See ‚ÄòDetails‚Äô. url_type Currently two possibilities: "ssb" (Norwegian) "ssb_en" (English). use_index Logical. TRUE, numeric values matched index variable metadata, usually starts 0. FALSE (default), numeric values interpreted row numbers metadata, using standard R indexing. Negative values can used specify reversed row numbers. default_query Specification variables included .... default default_query = c(1, -2, -1), selects first two last codes listed metadata. Use default_query = TRUE omit specifying individual variables retrieve entire tables. return_dataset Possible non-NULL values 1, 2 12. single data set returned data frame. make_na_status TRUE dataPackage "rjstat" missing entries value, function tries add additional variable, named NAstatus, status codes. explanation status codes provided note part comment attribute, .e. get note(). See bottom example. verbose_print TRUE, printing console

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî api_data
text: data frame, list data frames, depending input parameters.

title: PX-Web Data by API ‚Äî api_data
text: variable specified using variable name input parameter. value can specified either vector list. Vector input specified vector, results valueCodes specification. vector can specified way PxWebApi URL. addition, specification method inherited legacy ApiData() function PxWebApi v1 can used: TRUE means values equivalent "*". FALSE means eliminated, equivalent removing variable URL. meaningful variables can eliminated; see lower examples meta_frames(). Imaginary values represent top, e.g. 3i equivalent "top(3)". Numeric values interpreted row numbers (negative values allowed) indices; see parameter description use_index. Codes can specified directly, including use wildcards "*" "??". Labels may also used alternative codes. List input input named list, URL constructed directly names elements list (see examples). also possible omit name list element. case, element results valueCodes specification processed way vector input.

title: Ensure JSON-stat2 output format in PxWebApi v2 URLs ‚Äî ensure_json_stat2
text: function behaves follows: URL already contains outputFormat=json-stat2, returned unchanged. URL contains outputFormat parameter another value (e.g. csv), value replaced json-stat2, leaving rest URL unchanged. URL contain outputFormat parameter, outputFormat=json-stat2 appended. Matching parameter names values case-insensitive, resulting URL always uses canonical camelCase form outputFormat=json-stat2. function intended internal use guarantee consistent standardized output format across different PxWebApi v2 providers.

title: Ensure JSON-stat2 output format in PxWebApi v2 URLs ‚Äî ensure_json_stat2
text: function written documented help ChatGPT.

title: Ensure JSON-stat2 output format in PxWebApi v2 URLs ‚Äî ensure_json_stat2
code: url1 <- "https://api.no/data?lang=en" url1 #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en" ensure_json_stat2(url1) #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en&outputFormat=json-stat2"  url2 <- paste0(url1, "&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)") url2 #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)" ensure_json_stat2(url2) #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)&outputFormat=json-stat2"  url3 <- paste0(url1, "&outputFormat=csv&valueCodes[Tid]=?") url3 #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en&outputFormat=csv&valueCodes[Tid]=?" ensure_json_stat2(url3) #> [1] "https://api.no/data?lang=en&outputFormat=json-stat2&valueCodes[Tid]=?"

title: PX-Web API query URL ‚Äî query_url
text: url_or_tableid table id, PxWebApi v2 URL data metadata, metadata returned meta_data() meta_frames(). ... Specification query variable. See ‚ÄòDetails‚Äô api_data(). url_type Currently two possibilities: "ssb" (Norwegian) "ssb_en" (English). use_index Logical. TRUE, numeric values matched index variable metadata, usually starts 0. FALSE (default), numeric values interpreted row numbers metadata, using standard R indexing. Negative values can used specify reversed row numbers. default_query Specification variables included .... default default_query = c(1, -2, -1), selects first two last codes listed metadata. Use default_query = TRUE omit specifying individual variables retrieve entire tables.

title: PxWebApiData 1.9.0

title: PxWebApiData 1.1.1

title: PxWebApiData 1.1.0

title: PxWebApiData 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-01 package stable workhorse, now updated version 1.0.0. package now documentation site https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-pxwebapidata, providing easy access vignettes guides. Now comment attribute also includes elements tableid contents whenever available. Changed package license MIT, accordance policy Statistics Norway. Updated outdated region codes vignette Aggregations using filter agg. technical changes documentation comply standards.
